intro: Sisymbrium hararense, commonly known as the Harare mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear, hairy leaves. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Sisymbrium hararense is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
